stories.text:
Few more questions:

1. What's the limit and the diversity of the feeds do you have?

2. What software/service do you use now and prefer?

3. How far are you depended on the Social Media algorithms' prioritizing the contents that could potentially save much time?

4. What is the solution for the websites/social media that doesn't provide RSS feed in itself?

5. RSS feeds now - Worth it?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you manage RSS feeds effectively?

stories.text:
We often see certain topics that come around a lot. This week it seems to be variations on "paying open source developers".

Perhaps these can be marked as "forums" or "themes" and collected into a single post.

It is frustrating to watch the same idea posted every day, only to get swept away beyond post 500 or so. At best what we have now is that someone will add a comment that points to a prior post.

A simple (and therefore both controversial and wrong) solution would be to have a "link-to" button that forms a linked list (shades of lisp, eh Paul?).
stories.title: HN feature: A “forum” for topic threads that repeat
